listener.name: actionListeners

component.desc: UICommand is a base abstraction for components that implement ActionSource
component.longDesc: UICommand is a base abstraction for components that implement ActionSource.

property.name: immediate
property.desc: A boolean value that identifies the phase during which action events should fire
property.longDesc:
A boolean value that identifies the phase during which action events should fire.

During normal event processing, action methods and action listener methods are fired during the "invoke application" phase of request processing. If this attribute is set to "true", these methods are fired instead at the end of the "apply request values" phase.

property.name: value
property.desc: The text to display to the user for this command component
property.longDesc: The text to display to the user for this command component.

property.name: actionExpression
property.desc: The action to take when this command is invoked
property.longDesc:
The action to take when this command is invoked.

If the value is an expression, it is expected to be a method binding EL expression that identifies an action method. An action method accepts no parameters and has a String return value, called the action outcome, that identifies the next view displayed. The phase that this event is fired in can be controlled via the immediate attribute.

If the value is a string literal, it is treated as a navigation outcome for the current view. This is functionally equivalent to a reference to an action method that returns the string literal.

component.desc: Represents an abstraction of a component which has multiple "rows" of data
component.longDesc:
Represents an abstraction of a component which has multiple "rows" of data.

The children of this component are expected to be UIColumn components.

Note that the same set of child components are reused to implement each row of the table in turn during such phases as apply-request-values and render-response. Altering any of the members of these components therefore affects the attribute for every row, except for the following members:

  • submittedValue
  • value (where no EL binding is used)
  • valid

This reuse of the child components also means that it is not possible to save a reference to a component during table processing, then access it later and expect it to still represent the same row of the table.

Implementation Notes

Each of the UIColumn children of this component has a few component children of its own to render the contents of the table cell. However there can be a very large number of rows in a table, so it isn't efficient for the UIColumn and all its child objects to be duplicated for each row in the table. Instead the "flyweight" pattern is used where a serialized state is held for each row. When setRowIndex is invoked, the UIColumn objects and their children serialize their current state then reinitialise themselves from the appropriate saved state. This allows a single set of real objects to represent multiple objects which have the same types but potentially different internal state. When a row is selected for the first time, its state is set to a clean "initial" state. Transient components (including any read-only component) do not save their state; they are just reinitialised as required. The state saved/restored when changing rows is not the complete component state, just the fields that are expected to vary between rows: "submittedValue", "value", "isValid".

Note that a table is a "naming container", so that components within the table have their ids prefixed with the id of the table. Actually, when setRowIndex has been called on a table with id of "zzz" the table pretends to its children that its ID is "zzz_n" where n is the row index. This means that renderers for child components which call component.getClientId automatically get ids of form "zzz_n:childId" thus ensuring that components in different rows of the table get different ids.

When decoding a submitted page, this class iterates over all its possible rowIndex values, restoring the appropriate serialized row state then calling processDecodes on the child components. Because the child components (or their renderers) use getClientId to get the request key to look for parameter data, and because this object pretends to have a different id per row ("zzz_n") a single child component can decode data from each table row in turn without being aware that it is within a table. The table's data model is updated before each call to child.processDecodes, so the child decode method can assume that the data model's rowData points to the model object associated with the row currently being decoded. Exactly the same process applies for the later validation and updateModel phases.

When the data model for the table is bound to a backing bean property, and no validation errors have occured during processing of a postback, the data model is refetched at the start of the rendering phase (ie after the update model phase) so that the contents of the data model can be changed as a result of the latest form submission. Because the saved row state must correspond to the elements within the data model, the row state must be discarded whenever a new data model is fetched; not doing this would cause all sorts of inconsistency issues. This does imply that changing the state of any of the members "submittedValue", "value" or "valid" of a component within the table during the invokeApplication phase has no effect on the rendering of the table. When a validation error has occurred, a new DataModel is not fetched, and the saved state of the child components is not discarded.

see Javadoc of the JSF Specification for more information.

property.name: value
property.desc: An EL expression that specifies the data model that backs this table
property.longDesc:
An EL expression that specifies the data model that backs this table.

The value referenced by the EL expression can be of any type.

  • A value of type DataModel is used directly.
  • Array-like parameters of type array-of-Object, java.util.List, java.sql.ResultSet or javax.servlet.jsp.jstl.sql.Result are wrapped in a corresponding DataModel that knows how to iterate over the elements.
  • Other values are wrapped in a DataModel as a single row.

Note in particular that unordered collections, eg Set are not supported. Therefore if the value expression references such an object then the table will be considered to contain just one element - the collection itself.

property.name: first
property.desc: Defines the index of the first row to be displayed, starting from 0
property.longDesc: Defines the index of the first row to be displayed, starting from 0.

property.name: rows
property.desc: Defines the maximum number of rows of data to be displayed
property.longDesc:
Defines the maximum number of rows of data to be displayed.

Specify zero to display all rows from the "first" row to the end of available data.

property.name: var
property.desc: Defines the name of the request-scope variable that will hold the current row during iteration
property.longDesc:
Defines the name of the request-scope variable that will hold the current row during iteration.

During rendering of child components of this UIData, the variable with this name can be read to learn what the "rowData" object for the row currently being rendered is.

This value must be a static value, ie an EL expression is not permitted.

property.name: rowStatePreserved
property.desc: Indicates whether the state for a component in each row should not be discarded before the datatable is rendered again
property.longDesc:
Indicates whether the state for a component in each row should not be discarded before the datatable is rendered again.
This property is similar to tomahawk t:dataTable preserveRowStates
This will only work reliable if the datamodel of the datatable did not change either by sorting, removing or adding rows. Default: false

property.desc: An expression that specifies the Converter for this component
property.longDesc:
An expression that specifies the Converter for this component.

The value can either be a static value (ID) or an EL expression. When a static id is specified, an instance of the converter type registered with that id is used. When this is an EL expression, the result of evaluating the expression must be an object that implements the Converter interface.

During normal event processing, action methods and action listener methods are fired during the "invoke application" phase of request processing. If this attribute is set to "true", these methods are fired instead at the end of the "apply request values" phase.

property.name: required
property.desc: A boolean value that indicates whether an input value is required
property.longDesc:
A boolean value that indicates whether an input value is required.

If this value is true and no input value is provided by a postback operation, then the "requiredMessage" text is registered as a FacesMessage for the request, and validation fails.

Default value: false.

property.desc: Text to be displayed to the user as an error message when conversion of a submitted value to the target type fails
property.longDesc: Text to be displayed to the user as an error message when conversion of a submitted value to the target type fails.

property.desc: Text to be displayed to the user as an error message when this component is marked as "required" but no input data is present during a postback (ie the user left the required field blank)
property.longDesc: Text to be displayed to the user as an error message when this component is marked as "required" but no input data is present during a postback (ie the user left the required field blank).

property.name: validator
property.desc: A method-binding EL expression which is invoked during the validation phase for this component
property.longDesc:
A method-binding EL expression which is invoked during the validation phase for this component.

The invoked method is expected to check the submitted value for this component, and if not acceptable then report a validation error for the component.

The method is expected to have the prototype

public void aMethod(FacesContext, UIComponent,Object)

property.name: validatorMessage
property.desc: Text which will be shown if validation fails
property.longDesc: Text which will be shown if validation fails.

property.longDesc:
A method which is invoked during postback processing for the current view if the submitted value for this component is not equal to the value which the "value" expression for this component returns.

The phase in which this method is invoked can be controlled via the immediate attribute.

property.name: valid
property.desc: Specifies whether the component's value is currently valid, ie whether the validators attached to this component have allowed it
property.longDesc: Specifies whether the component's value is currently valid, ie whether the validators attached to this component have allowed it.

property.name: localValueSet
property.desc: Specifies whether a local value is currently set
property.longDesc:
Specifies whether a local value is currently set.

If false, values are being retrieved from any attached ValueBinding.

property.name: submittedValue
property.desc: Gets the current submitted value
property.longDesc: Gets the current submitted value. This value, if non-null, is set by the Renderer to store a possibly invalid value for later conversion or redisplay, and has not yet been converted into the proper type for this component instance. This method should only be used by the decode() and validate() method of this component, or its corresponding Renderer; however, user code may manually set it to null to erase any submitted value.

component.desc: Base class for the various component classes that allow a user to select zero or more options from a set
component.longDesc:
Base class for the various component classes that allow a user to select zero or more options from a set.

This is not an abstract class; java code can create an instance of this, configure its rendererType appropriately, and add it to a view. However there is no tag class for this component, ie it cannot be added directly to a page when using JSP (and other presentation technologies are expected to behave similarly). Instead, there is a family of subclasses that extend this base functionality, and they do have tag classes.

See the javadoc for this class in the JSF Specification for further details.

property.name: rendered
property.desc: DO NOT USE
property.longDesc:
DO NOT USE.

This inherited property is disabled. Although this class extends a base-class that defines a read/write rendered property, this particular subclass does not support setting it. Yes, this is broken OO design: direct all complaints to the JSF spec group.

property.name: id
property.desc: DO NOT USE
property.longDesc:
DO NOT USE.

Although this class extends a base-class that defines a read/write id property, it makes no sense for this particular subclass to support it. The tag library does not export this property for use, but there is no way to "undeclare" a java method. Yes, this is broken OO design: direct all complaints to the JSF spec group.

This property should be disabled (ie throw an exception if invoked). However there are currently several places that call this method (eg during restoreState) so it just does the normal thing for the moment. TODO: fix callers then make this throw an exception.

UISelectItem should be nestetd inside a UISelectMany or UISelectOne component, and results in the addition of a SelectItem instance to the list of available options for the parent component

component.name: h:column
component.desc: Creates a UIComponent that represents a single column of data within a parent UIData component
component.longDesc:
Creates a UIComponent that represents a single column of data within a parent UIData component.

This tag is commonly used as a child of the h:dataTable tag, to represent a column of data within an html table. It can be decorated with nested "header" and "footer" facets which cause the output of header and footer rows.

The non-facet child components of this column are re-rendered on each table row to generate the content of the cell. Those child components can reference the "var" attribute of the containing h:dataTable to generate appropriate output for each row.

component.name: h:dataTable
component.desc: This component renders an HTML table element
component.longDesc:
This component renders an HTML table element.

This component may have nested facets with names "header" and "footer" to specify header and footer rows.

The non-facet children of this component are expected to be h:column components which describe the columns of the table.

property.name: bgcolor
property.desc: HTML: The background color of this element
property.longDesc: HTML: The background color of this element.

property.name: bodyrows
property.desc: CSV of several row index to start (and end a previous) tbody element
property.longDesc: CSV of several row index to start (and end a previous) tbody element

property.name: border
property.desc: HTML: Specifies the width of the border of this element, in pixels
property.longDesc: HTML: Specifies the width of the border of this element, in pixels. Deprecated in HTML 4.01.

property.name: cellpadding
property.desc: HTML: Specifies the amount of empty space between the cell border and its contents
property.longDesc: HTML: Specifies the amount of empty space between the cell border and its contents. It can be either a pixel length or a percentage.

property.name: cellspacing
property.desc: HTML: Specifies the amount of space between the cells of the table
property.longDesc: HTML: Specifies the amount of space between the cells of the table. It can be either a pixel length or a percentage of available space.

property.name: columnClasses
property.desc: A comma separated list of CSS class names to apply to td elements in each column
property.longDesc: A comma separated list of CSS class names to apply to td elements in each column.

property.desc: The CSS class to be applied to footer cells
property.longDesc: The CSS class to be applied to footer cells.

property.name: frame
property.desc: HTML: Controls what part of the frame that surrounds a table is visible
property.longDesc: HTML: Controls what part of the frame that surrounds a table is visible. Values include: void, above, below, hsides, lhs, rhs, vsides, box, and border.

property.name: headerClass
property.desc: The CSS class to be applied to header cells
property.longDesc: The CSS class to be applied to header cells.

property.name: rowClasses
property.desc: A comma separated list of CSS class names to apply to td elements in each row
property.longDesc: A comma separated list of CSS class names to apply to td elements in each row.

property.name: rules
property.desc: HTML: Controls how rules are rendered between cells
property.longDesc: HTML: Controls how rules are rendered between cells. Values include: none, groups, rows, cols, and all.

property.name: summary
property.desc: HTML: Provides a summary of the contents of the table, for accessibility purposes
property.longDesc: HTML: Provides a summary of the contents of the table, for accessibility purposes.

property.name: width
property.desc: HTML: Specifies the desired width of the table, as a pixel length or a percentage of available space
property.longDesc: HTML: Specifies the desired width of the table, as a pixel length or a percentage of available space.

property.name: captionClass
property.desc: A comma separated list of CSS class names to apply to all captions
property.longDesc: A comma separated list of CSS class names to apply to all captions. If there are less classes than the number of rows, apply the same sequence of classes to the remaining captions, so the pattern is repeated. More than one class can be applied to a row by separating the classes with a space.

Renders all or some FacesMessages depending on the "for" and "globalOnly" attributes.
  • If globalOnly = true, only global messages, that have no associated clientId, will be displayed.
  • else if there is a "for" attribute, only messages that are assigned to the component referenced by the "for" attribute are displayed.
  • else all messages are displayed.

component.name: h:selectManyCheckbox
component.desc: Allow the user to select zero or more items from a set of available options
component.longDesc:
Allow the user to select zero or more items from a set of available options.

This is presented as a table with one cell per available option; each cell contains a checkbox and the option's label. The "layout" attribute determines whether the checkboxes are laid out horizontally or vertically.

The set of available options is defined by adding child f:selectItem or f:selectItems components to this component.

The value attribute must be a value-binding expression to a property of type List, Object array or primitive array. That "collection" is expected to contain objects of the same type as SelectItem.getValue() returns for the child SelectItem objects. On rendering, any child whose value is in the list will be selected initially. During the update phase, the property setter is called to replace the original collection with a completely new collection object of the appropriate type. The new collection object contains the value of each child SelectItem object that is currently selected.

component.name: h:selectManyListbox
component.desc: Allow the user to select zero or more items from a set of available options
component.longDesc:
Allow the user to select zero or more items from a set of available options. This is presented as a listbox which allows multiple rows in the list to be selected simultaneously.

The set of available options is defined by adding child f:selectItem or f:selectItems components to this component.

The list is rendered as an HTML select element. The "multiple" attribute is set on the element and the size attribute is set to the provided value, defaulting to the number of items in the list if no value is provided. If the size is set to 1, then a "drop-down" list (aka "combo-box") is presented, though if this is the intention then a selectManyMenu should be used instead.

The value attribute must be a value-binding expression to a property of type List, Object array or primitive array. That "collection" is expected to contain objects of the same type as SelectItem.getValue() returns for the child SelectItem objects. On rendering, any child whose value is in the list will be selected initially. During the update phase, the property is set to contain a "collection" of values for those child SelectItem objects that are currently selected.

component.name: h:selectManyMenu
component.desc: Allow the user to select zero or more items from a set of available options
component.longDesc:
Allow the user to select zero or more items from a set of available options. This is presented as a drop-down "combo-box" which allows multiple rows in the list to be selected simultaneously.

The set of available options is defined by adding child f:selectItem or f:selectItems components to this component.

Renders as an HTML select element, with the choices made up of child f:selectItem or f:selectItems elements. The multiple attribute is set and the size attribute is set to 1.

The value attribute must be a value-binding expression to a property of type List, Object array or primitive array. That "collection" is expected to contain objects of the same type as SelectItem.getValue() returns for the child SelectItem objects. On rendering, any child whose value is in the list will be selected initially. During the update phase, the property is set to contain a "collection" of values for those child SelectItem objects that are currently selected.

component.name: h:selectOneListbox
component.desc: Allow the user to choose one option from a set of options
component.longDesc:
Allow the user to choose one option from a set of options.

Rendered as a listbox with the MULTIPLE attribute set to false.

The available choices are defined via child f:selectItem or f:selectItems elements. The size of the listbox defaults to the number of available choices; if size is explicitly set to a smaller value, then scrollbars will be rendered. If size is set to 1 then a "drop-down menu" (aka "combo-box") is rendered, though if this is the intent then selectOneMenu should be used instead.

The value attribute of this component is read to determine which of the available options is initially selected; its value should match the "value" property of one of the child SelectItem objects.

On submit of the enclosing form, the value attribute's bound property is updated to contain the "value" property from the chosen SelectItem.

converter.name: f:convertDateTime
converter.desc: This tag associates a date time converter with the nearest parent UIComponent
converter.longDesc: This tag associates a date time converter with the nearest parent UIComponent. Unless otherwise specified, all attributes accept static values or EL expressions. see Javadoc of JSF Specification

property.name: dateStyle
property.desc: The style of the date
property.longDesc: The style of the date. Values include: default, short, medium, long, and full.

property.name: locale
property.desc: The name of the locale to be used, instead of the default
property.longDesc: The name of the locale to be used, instead of the default.

property.name: pattern
property.desc: A custom Date formatting pattern, in the format used by java
property.longDesc: A custom Date formatting pattern, in the format used by java.text.SimpleDateFormat.

property.name: timeStyle
property.desc: The style of the time
property.longDesc: The style of the time. Values include: default, short, medium, long, and full.

property.name: timeZone
property.desc: The time zone to use instead of GMT (the default timezone)
property.longDesc: The time zone to use instead of GMT (the default timezone). When this value is a value-binding to a TimeZone instance, that timezone is used. Otherwise this value is treated as a String containing a timezone id, ie as the ID parameter of method java.util.TimeZone.getTimeZone(String).

property.name: type
property.desc: Specifies whether the date, time, or both should be parsed/formatted
property.longDesc: Specifies whether the date, time, or both should be parsed/formatted. Values include: date, time, and both. Default based on setting of timeStyle and dateStyle.

property.name: binding
property.desc: A ValueExpression that evaluates to a DateTimeConverter.
property.longDesc: A ValueExpression that evaluates to a DateTimeConverter.

converter.name: f:convertNumber
converter.desc: This tag creates a number formatting converter and associates it with the nearest parent UIComponent
converter.longDesc: This tag creates a number formatting converter and associates it with the nearest parent UIComponent. Unless otherwise specified, all attributes accept static values or EL expressions. see Javadoc of JSF Specification

property.name: currencyCode
property.desc: ISO 4217 currency code
property.longDesc: ISO 4217 currency code

property.name: currencySymbol
property.desc: The currency symbol used to format a currency value
property.longDesc: The currency symbol used to format a currency value. Defaults to the currency symbol for locale.

property.name: groupingUsed
property.desc: Specifies whether output will contain grouping separators

validator.name: f:validateRegex
validator.longDesc:
RegexValidator is a {@link javax.faces.validator.Validator} that checks the value of the corresponding component against specified pattern using Java regular expression syntax. The regular expression syntax accepted by the RegexValidator class is same as mentioned in class {@link java.util.regex.Pattern} in package java.util.regex.

The following algorithm is implemented:

  • If the passed value is null, exit immediately.
  • If the passed value is not a String, exit with a {@link #NOT_MATCHED_MESSAGE_ID} error message.
  • If no pattern has been set, or pattern resolves to null or an empty String, throw a {@link javax.faces.validator.ValidatorException} with a {@link #PATTERN_NOT_SET_MESSAGE_ID} message.
  • If pattern is not a valid regular expression, according to the rules as defined in class {@link java.util.regex.Pattern}, throw a {@link ValidatorException} with a (@link #MATCH_EXCEPTION_MESSAGE_ID} message.
  • If a pattern property has been configured on this {@link javax.faces.validator.Validator}, check the passed value against this pattern. If value does not match pattern throw a {@link ValidatorException} containing a {@link #NOT_MATCHED_MESSAGE_ID} message.

property.name: pattern
property.desc: Return the ValueExpression that yields the regular expression pattern when evaluated
property.longDesc: Return the ValueExpression that yields the regular expression pattern when evaluated.

property.name: disabled
property.desc: no description

property.name: for
property.desc: no description

property.name: binding
property.desc: A ValueExpression that evaluates to a RegexValidator.
property.longDesc: A ValueExpression that evaluates to a RegexValidator.

validator.name: f:validateRequired
validator.desc: Check if a value is empty, in the same way as set UIInput required property to true (including all rules related to this property)
validator.longDesc: Check if a value is empty, in the same way as set UIInput required property to true (including all rules related to this property).

property.name: disabled
property.desc: no description

tag.name: f:facet
tag.desc: This tag adds its child as a facet of the nearest parent UIComponent
tag.longDesc: This tag adds its child as a facet of the nearest parent UIComponent. A child consisting of multiple elements should be nested within a container component (i.e., within an h:panelGroup for HTML library components). Unless otherwise specified, all attributes accept static values or EL expressions. see Javadoc of JSF Specification

attribute.name: name
attribute.desc: The name of the facet to be created
attribute.longDesc: The name of the facet to be created. This must be a static value.

faceletTag.desc: Handles setting a Converter instance on a ValueHolder
faceletTag.longDesc: Handles setting a Converter instance on a ValueHolder. Will wire all attributes set to the Converter instance created/fetched. Uses the "binding" attribute for grabbing instances to apply attributes to. <p/> Will only set/create Converter is the passed UIComponent's parent is null, signifying that it wasn't restored from an existing tree.

faceletTag.desc: Handles setting a Validator instance on a EditableValueHolder
faceletTag.longDesc: Handles setting a Validator instance on a EditableValueHolder. Will wire all attributes set to the Validator instance created/fetched. Uses the "binding" attribute for grabbing instances to apply attributes to. <p/> Will only set/create Validator is the passed UIComponent's parent is null, signifying that it wasn't restored from an existing tree.

webConfigParam.name: javax.faces.RESOURCE_EXCLUDES
webConfigParam.desc: Space separated file extensions that will not be served by the default ResourceHandler implementation
webConfigParam.longDesc: Space separated file extensions that will not be served by the default ResourceHandler implementation.

webConfigParam.name: javax.faces.STATE_SAVING_METHOD
webConfigParam.desc: Define the state method to be used. There are two different options " + "defined by the specification: 'client' and 'server' state.
webConfigParam.longDesc:
Define the state method to be used. There are two different options defined by the specification: "client" and "server" state.

When "client" state is configured, all state information required to create the tree is embedded within the data rendered to the client. Note that because data received from a remote client must always be treated as "tainted", care must be taken when using such data. Some StateManager implementations may use encryption to ensure that clients cannot modify the data, and that the data received on postback is therefore trustworthy.

When "server" state is configured, the data is saved somewhere "on the back end", and (at most) a token is embedded in the data rendered to the user.

webConfigParam.name: javax.faces.FULL_STATE_SAVING_VIEW_IDS
webConfigParam.desc: Indicate the viewId(s) separated by commas that should be saved and restored fully, without use Partial State Saving (PSS)
webConfigParam.longDesc: Indicate the viewId(s) separated by commas that should be saved and restored fully, without use Partial State Saving (PSS).

webConfigParam.name: javax.faces.PARTIAL_STATE_SAVING
webConfigParam.desc: Enable or disable partial state saving algorithm
webConfigParam.longDesc:
Enable or disable partial state saving algorithm.

Partial State Saving algorithm allows to reduce the size of the state required to save a view, keeping track of the "delta" or differences between the view build by first time and the current state of the view.

If the webapp faces-config file version is 2.0 or upper the default value is true, otherwise is false.

webConfigParam.name: javax.faces.DEFAULT_SUFFIX
webConfigParam.desc: Indicate the default suffixes, separated by spaces to derive the default file URI used by JSF to create views and render pages
webConfigParam.longDesc: Indicate the default suffixes, separated by spaces to derive the default file URI used by JSF to create views and render pages.

webConfigParam.name: javax.faces.FACELETS_SUFFIX
webConfigParam.desc: The default extension used to handle facelets pages
webConfigParam.longDesc: The default extension used to handle facelets pages.

webConfigParam.name: javax.faces.FACELETS_VIEW_MAPPINGS
webConfigParam.desc: Set of extensions handled by facelets, separated by ';'
webConfigParam.longDesc: Set of extensions handled by facelets, separated by ';'.

webConfigParam.name: javax.faces.HONOR_CURRENT_COMPONENT_ATTRIBUTES
webConfigParam.desc: Indicate if the facesContext attribute values under the keys javax
webConfigParam.longDesc: Indicate if the facesContext attribute values under the keys javax.faces.component.CURRENT_COMPONENT and javax.faces.component.CURRENT_COMPOSITE_COMPONENT should be valid or not. By default, those keys are deprecated since 2.1

webConfigParam.name: javax.faces.VALIDATE_EMPTY_FIELDS
webConfigParam.desc: Force validation on empty fields (By default is auto, which means it is only enabled when Bean Validation binaries are available on the current classpath)
webConfigParam.longDesc: Force validation on empty fields (By default is auto, which means it is only enabled when Bean Validation binaries are available on the current classpath).

webConfigParam.name: javax.faces.INTERPRET_EMPTY_STRING_SUBMITTED_VALUES_AS_NULL
webConfigParam.desc: Submitted values are decoded as null values instead empty strings
webConfigParam.longDesc:
Submitted values are decoded as null values instead empty strings.

Note this param is ignored for components extending from UISelectOne/UISelectMany.

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.ENUM_CONVERTER_ALLOW_STRING_PASSTROUGH
webConfigParam.desc: If value is a String instance and this param is true, pass it directly without try any change
webConfigParam.longDesc:
If value is a String instance and this param is true, pass it directly without try any change.
See MYFACES-2739 for details.

webConfigParam.name: javax.faces.validator.DISABLE_DEFAULT_BEAN_VALIDATOR
webConfigParam.desc: If this init parameter is present, no Bean Validators should be added to an UIInput by default
webConfigParam.longDesc: If this init parameter is present, no Bean Validators should be added to an UIInput by default. Explicitly adding a BeanValidator to an UIInput is possible though.

webConfigParam.name: javax.faces.CONFIG_FILES
webConfigParam.desc: Comma separated list of URIs of (additional) faces config files
webConfigParam.longDesc: Comma separated list of URIs of (additional) faces config files. (e.g. /WEB-INF/my-config.xml)See JSF 1.0 PRD2, 10.3.2 Attention: You do not need to put /WEB-INF/faces-config.xml in here.

webConfigParam.name: javax.faces.LIFECYCLE_ID
webConfigParam.desc: Identify the Lifecycle instance to be used
webConfigParam.longDesc: Identify the Lifecycle instance to be used.

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.ERROR_HANDLER
webConfigParam.desc: Deprecated: use JSF 2.0 ExceptionHandler
webConfigParam.longDesc:
Since JSF 2.0 there is a standard way to deal with unexpected Exceptions: the ExceptionHandler. Due to backwards compatibility MyFaces 2.0 also supports the init parameter org.apache.myfaces.ERROR_HANDLER, introduced in MyFaces 1.2.4. However, the given error handler now only needs to include the following method:
  • handleException(FacesContext fc, Exception ex)
Furthermore, the init parameter only works when using the PreJsf2ExceptionHandlerFactory.

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.CHECKED_VIEWID_CACHE_SIZE
webConfigParam.desc: Controls the size of the cache used to 'remember' if a view exists or not.
webConfigParam.longDesc: Controls the size of the cache used to "remember" if a view exists or not.

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.CHECKED_VIEWID_CACHE_ENABLED
webConfigParam.desc: Enable or disable a cache used to 'remember' if a view exists or not and reduce the impact " + "of sucesive calls to ExternalContext.getResource().
webConfigParam.longDesc: Enable or disable a cache used to "remember" if a view exists or not and reduce the impact of sucesive calls to ExternalContext.getResource().

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.RESOURCE_VIRTUAL_PATH
webConfigParam.desc: Set the virtual path used to serve resources using tomahawk addResource API
webConfigParam.longDesc: Set the virtual path used to serve resources using tomahawk addResource API. Note ExtensionsFilter should be able to receive request on the prefix used here.

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.PRETTY_HTML
webConfigParam.desc: If true, rendered HTML code will be formatted, so that it is "human readable"
webConfigParam.longDesc: If true, rendered HTML code will be formatted, so that it is "human readable". i.e. additional line separators and whitespace will be written, that do not influence the HTML code. Default: "true"
webConfigParam.expectedValues: true, false, on, off, yes, no

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.ALLOW_JAVASCRIPT
webConfigParam.desc: This parameter tells MyFaces if javascript code should be allowed in the rendered HTML output
webConfigParam.longDesc: This parameter tells MyFaces if javascript code should be allowed in the rendered HTML output. If javascript is allowed, command_link anchors will have javascript code that submits the corresponding form. If javascript is not allowed, the state saving info and nested parameters ill be added as url parameters. Default: "true"
webConfigParam.expectedValues: true, false, on, off, yes, no

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.DETECT_JAVASCRIPT
webConfigParam.desc: Deprecated: tomahawk specific param to detect javascript, but it is no longer valid anymore
webConfigParam.longDesc: Deprecated: tomahawk specific param to detect javascript, but it is no longer valid anymore.
webConfigParam.expectedValues: true, false, on, off, yes, no

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.AUTO_SCROLL
webConfigParam.desc: If true, a javascript function will be rendered that is able to restore the former vertical scroll on every request
webConfigParam.longDesc: If true, a javascript function will be rendered that is able to restore the former vertical scroll on every request. Convenient feature if you have pages with long lists and you do not want the browser page to always jump to the top if you trigger a link or button action that stays on the same page. Default: "false"
webConfigParam.expectedValues: true, false, on, off, yes, no

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.ADD_RESOURCE_CLASS
webConfigParam.desc: Tomahawk specific: Indicate the class responsible to place scripts and css using " + "tomahawk AddResource API
webConfigParam.longDesc: Tomahawk specific: A class implementing the org.apache.myfaces.shared.renderkit.html.util.AddResource interface. It is responsible to place scripts and css on the right position in your HTML document. Default: "org.apache.myfaces.shared.renderkit.html.util.DefaultAddResource" Follow the description on the MyFaces-Wiki-Performance page to enable StreamingAddResource instead of DefaultAddResource if you want to gain performance.

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.CHECK_EXTENSIONS_FILTER
webConfigParam.desc: Tomahawk specific: This parameter will check for a properly configured Extensions-Filter if " + "it is needed by the web-app.
webConfigParam.longDesc:
Tomahawk specific: A very common problem in configuring MyFaces-web-applications is that the Extensions-Filter is not configured at all or improperly configured. This parameter will check for a properly configured Extensions-Filter if it is needed by the web-app. In most cases this check will work just fine, there might be cases where an internal forward will bypass the Extensions-Filter and the check will not work. If this is the case, you can disable the check by setting this parameter to false.
In tomahawk for JSF 2.0 since version 1.1.11, this param is set by default to false, otherwise is true.
webConfigParam.defaultValue: for JSF 2.0 since 1.1.11 false, otherwise true
webConfigParam.expectedValues: true, false, on, off, yes, no

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.READONLY_AS_DISABLED_FOR_SELECTS
webConfigParam.desc: Tomahawk specific: Interpret "readonly" property as "disable" for select components like t:selectOneRow
webConfigParam.longDesc: Tomahawk specific: Interpret "readonly" property as "disable" for select components like t:selectOneRow.
webConfigParam.expectedValues: true, false, on, off, yes, no

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.CONFIG_REFRESH_PERIOD
webConfigParam.desc: Set the time in seconds that check for updates of web
webConfigParam.longDesc: Set the time in seconds that check for updates of web.xml and faces-config descriptors and refresh the configuration. This param is valid only if project stage is not production. Set this param to 0 disable this feature.

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.VIEWSTATE_JAVASCRIPT
webConfigParam.desc: Set the view state using a javascript function instead a hidden input field
webConfigParam.longDesc: Set the view state using a javascript function instead a hidden input field.
webConfigParam.expectedValues: true, false, on, off, yes, no

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.RENDER_VIEWSTATE_ID
webConfigParam.desc: Define if the input field that should store the state (javax
webConfigParam.longDesc:
Define if the input field that should store the state (javax.faces.ViewState) should render id="javax.faces.ViewState". JSF API 1.2 defines a "javax.faces.ViewState" client parameter, that must be rendered as both the "name" and the "id" attribute of the hidden input that is rendered for the purpose of state saving (see ResponseStateManager.VIEW_STATE_PARAM). Actually this causes duplicate id attributes and thus invalid XHTML pages when multiple forms are rendered on one page. With the org.apache.myfaces.RENDER_VIEWSTATE_ID context parameter you can tune this behaviour.
Set it to
  • true - to render JSF 1.2 compliant id attributes (that might cause invalid XHTML), or
  • false - to omit rendering of the id attribute (which is only needed for very special AJAX/Javascript components)
Default value is: true (for backwards compatibility and JSF 1.2 compliancy)
webConfigParam.expectedValues: true, false, on, off, yes, no

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.STRICT_XHTML_LINKS
webConfigParam.desc: Use "&amp;" entity instead a plain "&" character within HTML
webConfigParam.longDesc:
Use "&" entity instead a plain "&" character within HTML.

W3C recommends to use the "&" entity instead of a plain "&" character within HTML. This also applies to attribute values and thus to the "href" attribute of <a> elements as well. Even more, when XHTML is used as output the usage of plain "&" characters is forbidden and would lead to invalid XML code. Therefore, since version 1.1.6 MyFaces renders the correct "&" entity for links.

The init parameter org.apache.myfaces.STRICT_XHTML_LINKS makes it possible to restore the old behaviour and to make MyFaces "bug compatible" to the Sun RI which renders plain "&" chars in links as well.

See: HTML 4.01 Specification See: Jira: MYFACES-1774
webConfigParam.expectedValues: true, false, on, off, yes, no

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.RENDER_CLEAR_JAVASCRIPT_FOR_BUTTON
webConfigParam.desc: This param renders the clear javascript on button necessary only for compatibility with hidden fields feature of myfaces
webConfigParam.longDesc: This param renders the clear javascript on button necessary only for compatibility with hidden fields feature of myfaces. This is done because jsf ri does not render javascript on onclick method for button, so myfaces should do this.
webConfigParam.expectedValues: true, false, on, off, yes, no

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.RENDER_HIDDEN_FIELDS_FOR_LINK_PARAMS
webConfigParam.desc: This param renders hidden fields at the end of h:form for link params when h:commandLink + f:param is used, instead use javascript to create them
webConfigParam.longDesc: This param renders hidden fields at the end of h:form for link params when h:commandLink + f:param is used, instead use javascript to create them. Set this param to true also enables org.apache.myfaces.RENDER_CLEAR_JAVASCRIPT_FOR_BUTTON automatically to ensure consistency. This feature is required to support Windows Mobile 6, because in this environment, document.createElement() and form.appendChild() javascript methods are not supported.
webConfigParam.expectedValues: true, false, on, off, yes, no

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.SAVE_FORM_SUBMIT_LINK_IE
webConfigParam.desc: Add a code that save the form before submit using a link (call to window
webConfigParam.longDesc: Add a code that save the form before submit using a link (call to window.external.AutoCompleteSaveForm(form) ). It's a bug on IE.
webConfigParam.expectedValues: true, false, on, off, yes, no

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.DELEGATE_FACES_SERVLET
webConfigParam.desc: Define an alternate class name that will be used to initialize MyFaces, instead the default javax
webConfigParam.longDesc:
Define an alternate class name that will be used to initialize MyFaces, instead the default javax.faces.webapp.FacesServlet.

This helps MyFaces to detect the mappings and other additional configuration used to setup the environment, and prevent abort initialization if no FacesServlet config is detected.

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.REFRESH_TRANSIENT_BUILD_ON_PSS
webConfigParam.desc: Indicate if the facelet associated to the view should be reapplied when the view is refreshed
webConfigParam.longDesc:
Indicate if the facelet associated to the view should be reapplied when the view is refreshed. Default mode is "auto".

This param is only valid when partial state saving is on. If this is set as true, the tag-handlers are always reapplied before render view, like in facelets 1.1.x, allowing c:if work correctly to "toggle" components based on a value changed on invoke application phase. If the param is set as "auto", the implementation check if c:if, c:forEach, c:choose and ui:include with src=ELExpression is used on the page and if that so, mark the view to be refreshed.

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.REFRESH_TRANSIENT_BUILD_ON_PSS_PRESERVE_STATE
webConfigParam.desc: Enable or disable a special mode that enable full state for parent components containing c:if, c:forEach, c:choose and ui:include with src=ELExpression
webConfigParam.longDesc:
Enable or disable a special mode that enable full state for parent components containing c:if, c:forEach, c:choose and ui:include with src=ELExpression. By default is disabled(false).

This param is only valid when partial state saving is on. If this is set as true, parent components containing c:if, c:forEach, c:choose and ui:include with src=ELExpression are marked to be restored fully, so state is preserved between request.
webConfigParam.expectedValues: true, false, on, off, yes, no

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.VALIDATE_XML
webConfigParam.desc: If set to true, tag library XML files and faces config XML files using schema will be validated during application start up
webConfigParam.longDesc: If set to true, tag library XML files and faces config XML files using schema will be validated during application start up
webConfigParam.expectedValues: true, false, on, off, yes, no

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.WRAP_SCRIPT_CONTENT_WITH_XML_COMMENT_TAG
webConfigParam.desc: Wrap content inside script with xml comment to prevent old browsers to display it
webConfigParam.longDesc: Wrap content inside script with xml comment to prevent old browsers to display it. By default it is true.
webConfigParam.expectedValues: true, false, on, off, yes, no

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.RENDER_FORM_SUBMIT_SCRIPT_INLINE
webConfigParam.desc: If set true, render the form submit script inline, as in myfaces core 1
webConfigParam.longDesc: If set true, render the form submit script inline, as in myfaces core 1.2 and earlier versions
webConfigParam.expectedValues: true, false, on, off, yes, no

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.DEBUG_PHASE_LISTENER
webConfigParam.desc: Enable/disable DebugPhaseListener feature, with provide useful information about ValueHolder variables (submittedValue, localValue, value)
webConfigParam.longDesc: Enable/disable DebugPhaseListener feature, with provide useful information about ValueHolder variables (submittedValue, localValue, value). Note evaluate those getters for each component could cause some unwanted side effects when using "access" type scopes like on MyFaces CODI. This param only has effect when project stage is Development.

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.STRICT_JSF_2_REFRESH_TARGET_AJAX
webConfigParam.desc: Detect if a target (usually head) should be update for the current view in an ajax render operation
webConfigParam.longDesc: Detect if a target (usually head) should be update for the current view in an ajax render operation. This is activated if a css or js resource is added dynamically by effect of a refresh (c:if, ui:include src="#{...}" or a manipulation of the tree). This ensures ajax updates of content using ui:include will be consistent. Note this behavior is a myfaces specific extension, so to ensure strict compatibility with the spec, set this param to false (default false).

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.STRICT_JSF_2_CC_EL_RESOLVER
webConfigParam.desc: Change default getType() behavior for composite component EL resolver, from return null (see JSF 2_0 spec section 5_6_2_2) to use the metadata information added by composite:attribute, ensuring components working with chained EL expressions to find the right type when a getType() is called over the source EL expression
webConfigParam.longDesc:
Change default getType() behavior for composite component EL resolver, from return null (see JSF 2_0 spec section 5_6_2_2) to use the metadata information added by composite:attribute, ensuring components working with chained EL expressions to find the right type when a getType() is called over the source EL expression.
To ensure strict compatibility with the spec set this param to true (by default is false, so the change is enabled by default).

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.DEFAULT_RESPONSE_WRITER_CONTENT_TYPE_MODE
webConfigParam.desc: Define the default content type that the default ResponseWriter generates, when no match can be derived from HTTP Accept Header
webConfigParam.longDesc: Define the default content type that the default ResponseWriter generates, when no match can be derived from HTTP Accept Header.

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.VIEW_UNIQUE_IDS_CACHE_ENABLED
webConfigParam.desc: Enable or disable a cache used to 'remember' the generated facelets unique ids " + "and reduce the impact over memory usage.
webConfigParam.longDesc: Enable or disable a cache used to "remember" the generated facelets unique ids and reduce the impact on memory usage, only active if javax.faces.FACELETS_REFRESH_PERIOD is -1 (no refresh).

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.COMPONENT_UNIQUE_IDS_CACHE_SIZE
webConfigParam.desc: Set the size of the cache used to store strings generated using SectionUniqueIdCounter for component ids
webConfigParam.longDesc: Set the size of the cache used to store strings generated using SectionUniqueIdCounter for component ids. If this is set to 0, no cache is used. By default is set to 100.

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.SUPPORT_JSP_AND_FACES_EL
webConfigParam.desc: If set false, myfaces won't support JSP and javax.faces.el. JSP are deprecated in " + "JSF 2.X, javax.faces.el in in JSF 1.2. Default value is true.
webConfigParam.longDesc:
If set false, myfaces won't support JSP and javax.faces.el. JSP are deprecated in JSF 2.X, javax.faces.el in in JSF 1.2. Default value is true.
If this property is set is false, JSF 1.1 VariableResolver and PropertyResolver config (replaced in JSF 1.2 by ELResolver) and all related logic for JSP is skipped, making EL evaluation faster.

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.GAE_JSF_JAR_FILES
webConfigParam.desc: When the application runs inside Google Application Engine container (GAE), indicate which jar files should be scanned for files (faces-config, facelets taglib or annotations)
webConfigParam.longDesc: When the application runs inside Google Application Engine container (GAE), indicate which jar files should be scanned for files (faces-config, facelets taglib or annotations). It accept simple wildcard patterns like myfavoritejsflib-*.jar or myfavoritejsflib-1.1.?.jar. By default, all the classpath is scanned for files annotations (so it adds an small delay on startup).

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.GAE_JSF_ANNOTATIONS_JAR_FILES
webConfigParam.desc: When the application runs inside Google Application Engine container (GAE), indicate which jar files should be scanned for annotations
webConfigParam.longDesc: When the application runs inside Google Application Engine container (GAE), indicate which jar files should be scanned for annotations. This param overrides org.apache.myfaces.GAE_JSF_JAR_FILES behavior that tries to find faces-config.xml or files ending with .faces-config.xml in /META-INF folder and if that so, try to find JSF annotations in the whole jar file. It accept simple wildcard patterns like myfavoritejsflib-*.jar or myfavoritejsflib-1.1.?.jar. By default, all the classpath is scanned for annotations (so it adds an small delay on startup).

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.FLASH_SCOPE_DISABLED
webConfigParam.desc: Defines whether flash scope is disabled, preventing add the Flash cookie to the response
webConfigParam.longDesc:
Defines whether flash scope is disabled, preventing add the Flash cookie to the response.

This is useful for applications that does not require to use flash scope, and instead uses other scopes.

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.RESOURCE_MAX_TIME_EXPIRES
webConfigParam.desc: Set the max time in miliseconds set on the "Expires" header for a resource rendered by the default ResourceHandler
webConfigParam.longDesc: Set the max time in miliseconds set on the "Expires" header for a resource rendered by the default ResourceHandler. (default to one week in miliseconds or 604800000)

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.RESOURCE_HANDLER_CACHE_SIZE
webConfigParam.desc: Controls the size of the cache used to check if a resource exists or not
webConfigParam.longDesc:
Controls the size of the cache used to check if a resource exists or not.

See org.apache.myfaces.RESOURCE_HANDLER_CACHE_ENABLED for details.

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.RESOURCE_HANDLER_CACHE_ENABLED
webConfigParam.desc: Enable or disable the cache used to "remember" if a resource handled by the default ResourceHandler exists or not
webConfigParam.longDesc: Enable or disable the cache used to "remember" if a resource handled by the default ResourceHandler exists or not.

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.USE_ENCRYPTION
webConfigParam.desc: Indicate if the view state is encrypted or not
webConfigParam.longDesc: Indicate if the view state is encrypted or not. By default, encryption is enabled.

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.SECRET
webConfigParam.desc: Defines the secret (Base64 encoded) used to initialize the secret key for encryption algorithm
webConfigParam.longDesc: Defines the secret (Base64 encoded) used to initialize the secret key for encryption algorithm. See MyFaces wiki/web site documentation for instructions on how to configure an application for different encryption strengths.

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.ALGORITHM
webConfigParam.desc: Indicate the encryption algorithm used for encrypt the view state
webConfigParam.longDesc: Indicate the encryption algorithm used for encrypt the view state.

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.SECRET.CACHE
webConfigParam.desc: If is set to "false", the secret key used for encryption algorithm is not cached
webConfigParam.longDesc: If is set to "false", the secret key used for encryption algorithm is not cached. This is used when the returned SecretKey for encryption algorithm is not thread safe.

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.ALGORITHM.IV
webConfigParam.desc: Defines the initialization vector (Base64 encoded) used for the encryption algorithm
webConfigParam.longDesc: Defines the initialization vector (Base64 encoded) used for the encryption algorithm

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.ALGORITHM.PARAMETERS
webConfigParam.desc: Defines the default mode and padding used for the encryption algorithm
webConfigParam.longDesc: Defines the default mode and padding used for the encryption algorithm

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.SERIAL_FACTORY
webConfigParam.desc: Defines the factory class name using for serialize/deserialize the view state returned by state manager into a byte array
webConfigParam.longDesc: Defines the factory class name using for serialize/deserialize the view state returned by state manager into a byte array. The expected class must implement org.apache.myfaces.shared.util.serial.SerialFactory interface.

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.COMPRESS_STATE_IN_CLIENT
webConfigParam.desc: Indicate if the view state should be compressed before encrypted(optional) and encoded
webConfigParam.longDesc: Indicate if the view state should be compressed before encrypted(optional) and encoded

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.MAC_ALGORITHM
webConfigParam.desc: Indicate the algorithm used to calculate the Message Authentication Code that is added to the view state
webConfigParam.longDesc: Indicate the algorithm used to calculate the Message Authentication Code that is added to the view state.

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.MAC_SECRET
webConfigParam.desc: Define the initialization code that are used to initialize the secret key used on the Message Authentication Code algorithm
webConfigParam.longDesc: Define the initialization code that are used to initialize the secret key used on the Message Authentication Code algorithm

webConfigParam.name: org.apache.myfaces.MAC_SECRET.CACHE
webConfigParam.desc: If is set to "false", the secret key used for MAC algorithm is not cached
webConfigParam.longDesc: If is set to "false", the secret key used for MAC algorithm is not cached. This is used when the returned SecretKey for mac algorithm is not thread safe.
